title: "Data Sources"

This is not meant to be an exhaustive list of all data sources, as that would be impossible to put on a page. However, it should give you a starting point and might spark a few ideas.


## United Kingdom
- [Bank of England](https://www.bankofengland.co.uk/news/statistics) — The UK’s central bank.
- [British Film Institute](https://www.bfi.org.uk/industry-data-insights/) — Research data and market intelligence on the UK film industry and other screen sectors.
- [Civil Aviation Authority](https://www.caa.co.uk/data-and-analysis/) — Aviation data, statistics and reports.
- [Companies House](http://download.companieshouse.gov.uk/en_output.html) — Downloadable data snapshot containing basic company data of live companies on the Companies House register. Also available as an [API](https://developer.company-information.service.gov.uk/).
- [Energy Performance of Buildings](https://epc.opendatacommunities.org/) — The official place for all Energy Performance Certificates (EPCs), Display Energy Certificates (DECs) and Air Conditioning Inspection Reports (ACIRs).
- [Financial Conduct Authority](https://www.fca.org.uk/data) — Official data on financial services firms. See also the [register of firms](https://register.fca.org.uk/s/).
- [GOV.UK](https://www.gov.uk/search/research-and-statistics) — Official data from various government sources.
- [Halifax House Price Index](https://www.halifax.co.uk/media-centre/house-price-index.html) — The Halifax House Price Index is the UK’s longest running monthly house price series with data covering the whole country going back to January 1983.
- [Higher Education Statistics Agency](https://www.hesa.ac.uk/data-and-analysis) — Data on all aspects of the UK higher education sector.
- [HM Land Registry](https://landregistry.data.gov.uk/) — Price paid, transaction and UK House Price Index, updated monthly.
- [House of Lords Register of Interests](https://members.parliament.uk/members/lords/interests/register-of-lords-interests) — Information on any financial or non-financial benefit received by a Member of the Lords.
- [House of Commons Library](https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-for-commons-business/) — Information and analysis on legislation, policy areas and topical issues.
- [Meta Ad Library](https://www.facebook.com/ads/library/) — Search all of the ads currently running across Meta technologies, primarily used for Facebook.
- [National River Flow Archive](https://nrfa.ceh.ac.uk/) — The UK’s official record of river flow data.
- [NHS Digital](https://digital.nhs.uk/data) — The statutory custodian for health and care data for England.
- [Nomis](https://www.nomisweb.co.uk/) — Statistics related to population, society and the labour market at national, regional and local levels.
- [Ofcom](https://www.ofcom.org.uk/research-and-data/data) — The regulator for communications services, including broadband, home phone, mobile services, TV and radio.
- [Ofgem](https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/energy-data-and-research) — Great Britain’s independent energy regulator.
- [Office for Budget Responsibility](https://obr.uk/publications/) — The OBR produces a variety of publications in pursuit of its duty to examine and report on the sustainability of the public finances.
- [Office for National Statistics](https://www.ons.gov.uk/) — The UK official statistics body.
- [Office for Students](https://www.officeforstudents.org.uk/data-and-analysis/) — Data-driven analysis and essential evidence on key trends and current issues in English higher education.
- [Office of Rail and Road](https://dataportal.orr.gov.uk/) — Government department responsible for the economic and safety regulation of Britain’s railways, and the economic monitoring of National Highways.
- [Office of the Registrar of Consultant Lobbyists](https://registrarofconsultantlobbyists.org.uk/) — Set up to ensure transparency in the work of consultant lobbyists and their engagement with Ministers and Permanent Secretaries on behalf of clients.
- [Parliament.uk](https://explore.data.parliament.uk/) — A list of open datasets supported by the Parliamentary Digital Service.
- [Police.uk](https://data.police.uk/) — Open data about crime and policing in England, Wales and Northern Ireland.
- [Register of data protection fee payers](https://ico.org.uk/about-the-ico/what-we-do/register-of-fee-payers/) — Organisations and people registered with the Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO) under the Data Protection Act 2018.
- [Register of charities](https://register-of-charities.charitycommission.gov.uk/) — Information about registered charities in England and Wales
- [Schools](https://get-information-schools.service.gov.uk/) — The Department for Education’s register for several organisation types and where information on other organisations is recorded and maintained.
- [Stat-Xplore](https://stat-xplore.dwp.gov.uk/) — A guided way to explore Department for Work & Pensions benefit statistics, currently holding data relating to a range of different benefits/programmes.
- [UK AIR](https://uk-air.defra.gov.uk/) — Data about air quality and pollution in the UK.
- [UK Finance](https://www.ukfinance.org.uk/data-research) — Data and analysis of banking and finance industry activity.
- [Universities and Colleges Admissions Service](https://www.ucas.com/data-and-analysis/) — An independent charity, and the UK’s shared admissions service for higher education.

## Other countries
- 🇦🇺 [Australian Bureau of Statistics](https://www.abs.gov.au/) — Australia’s national statistical agency and an official source of independent, reliable information.
- 🇺🇸 [Bureau of Labor Statistics](https://www.bls.gov/) — The principal fact-finding agency for the U.S. government in the broad field of labor economics and statistics.
- 🇮🇪 [Central Statistics Office](https://www.cso.ie/en/) — Ireland’s national statistical office that collects, analyses and makes available statistics about Ireland’s people, society and economy.
- 🇺🇸 [Economic Research Service](https://www.ers.usda.gov/) — Trends and emerging issues in agriculture, food, the environment, and rural America.
- 🇺🇸 [Energy Information Administration](https://www.eia.gov/) — Independent and impartial energy information to promote sound policymaking, efficient markets, and public understanding of energy and its interaction with the economy and the environment.
- 🇺🇸 [New York Fed](https://www.newyorkfed.org/data-and-statistics) — Provides the date and time of key economic data releases.
- 🇨🇦 [Statistics Canada](https://www.statcan.gc.ca/en/start) — Statistics Canada is the national statistical office of Canada.
- 🇩🇪 [Statistisches Bundesamt](https://www.destatis.de/EN/Home/_node.html) — Official data on the society, the economy, the environment and the state of Germany.

## International sources
- 🌍 [Bank for International Settlements](https://data.bis.org/) — Compiled in cooperation with central banks and other national authorities, are designed to inform analysis of financial stability, international monetary spillovers and global liquidity.
- 🇪🇺 [European Central Bank](https://www.ecb.europa.eu/pub/html/index.en.html) — Economic research on a wide range of topics in Europe.| Europe|
- 🇪🇺 [Eurostat](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/main/home) — The statistical office of the European Union
- 🌍 [Inside Airbnb](http://insideairbnb.com/) — A mission driven project that provides data and advocacy about Airbnb’s impact on residential communities.
- 🌍 [International Energy Agency](https://www.iea.org/data-and-statistics) — Intergovernmental organisation, established in 1974, that provides policy recommendations, analysis and data on the entire global energy sector.
- 🌍 [International Monetary Fund](https://data.imf.org/) — International macroeconomic and financial data.
- 🌍 [OECD](https://data.oecd.org/) — Data, policy advice and research on the economy, education, employment, environment, health, tax, trade, GDP, unemployment rate, etc.
- 🌍 [UNdata](http://data.un.org/) — A variety of statistical resources compiled by the United Nations (UN) statistical system and other international agencies.
